solution_line_template: She has {num_grandchildren} grandchildren {num_children} children so she needs {num_grandchildren}+{num_children} = <<{num_grandchildren}+{num_children}={total_stockings}>>{total_stockings} stockings

The stockings are ${stocking_price_each} each and currently {discount_percent_num}% off so that's {stocking_price_each}*{discount_percent_decimal} = $<<{stocking_price_each}*{discount_percent_decimal}={discount_amount_per_stocking}>>{discount_amount_per_stocking} off

The stockings are ${stocking_price_each} with a ${discount_amount_per_stocking} discount so they are each {stocking_price_each}-{discount_amount_per_stocking} = $<<{stocking_price_each}-{discount_amount_per_stocking}={price_after_discount_per_stocking}>>{price_after_discount_per_stocking}

The stockings are now ${price_after_discount_per_stocking} and she needs {total_stockings} so that's $<<{price_after_discount_per_stocking}*{total_stockings}={total_stocking_cost_after_discount}>>{total_stocking_cost_after_discount}.00

She also wants to monogram each stocking at ${monogramming_cost_per_stocking} per stocking so that's {total_stockings}*{monogramming_cost_per_stocking} = $<<{total_stockings}*{monogramming_cost_per_stocking}={total_monogramming_cost}>>{total_monogramming_cost}

The stockings are ${total_stocking_cost_after_discount} and the monogramming will cost ${total_monogramming_cost} so the stockings will cost {total_stocking_cost_after_discount}+{total_monogramming_cost} = $<<{total_stocking_cost_after_discount}+{total_monogramming_cost}={final_total_cost}>>{final_total_cost}
